abstract: House Intelligence Committee releases report on former intelligence contractor Edward J Snowden, who has been living as fugitive in Russia since revealing classified files about American surveillance operations in 2013; report says Snowden caused harm and risk to American troops and that he has been in contact with Russian intelligence services, but conclusions are hard to verify due to extensive redactions; Snowden refutes report.

headline.print_headline: Report, Evidence Redacted, Ties Snowden to Russian Agencies
headline.main: House Report, Evidence Redacted, Ties Snowden to Russian Agencies

snippet: The report also portrays Edward J. Snowden, who in 2013 disclosed classified files about American surveillance operations, as a habitually disgruntled worker....
lead_paragraph: The report also portrays Edward J. Snowden, who in 2013 disclosed classified files about American surveillance operations, as a habitually disgruntled worker.
